admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF020101-ITALIAN GRANT - ALBANIA RURAL
            ROADS PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory: the
            objectives of the project were achieved. Sustainability of
            the project is likely. Both World Bank and Borrower
            performances were adjudged to be satisfactory. Several
            lessons learned from this project include the following:
            Good projects are usually the result of adequate
            coordination of the work with good counterparts. Road
            administration should keep in mind that planning for the use
            of resources should be based on an economic analysis which
            justifies the optimal choice for improving road sections;
            contracting on a competitive basis increases procurement
            transparency, decreases cost, and improves efficiency and
            quality; careful supervision including timely payments, are
            essential; and expropriations and final designs should be
            ready for bidding well before starting related works. Full
            development of agricultural areas depends on the existence
            of a good rural road network and access to the main road
            network. Domestic contractors and consultants benefit from
            IDA projects. Application of a labor-intensive method has
            social and economic benefits in creating employment and
            alleviating poverty. Local government should be responsible
            for the rural road network. Bureaucratic procedures delay payments.
